pull.title: qa: Fix wallet_listreceivedby race
pull.body:
Generating a block on node 0 will only get node 0 out of IBD and not node 1. So the inv for the `txid` is dropped by node 1 and the call to `sync_all` fails.

Solve it by a call to `sync_blocks` after `generate`.

events.body: One of the travis failures for reference: https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/377321319

verification.payload:
tree 821bbab41eb0738323e8522403020291a36e89ed
parent d792e47421fcb9ce3b381c1e6d8902777ae3f9f3
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1527023239 -0400
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1527083534 -0400

qa: Fix wallet_listreceivedby race

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -18,8 +21,7 @@ def set_test_params(self):
     def run_test(self):
         # Generate block to get out of IBD
         self.nodes[0].generate(1)
-
-        self.log.info("listreceivedbyaddress Test")
+        sync_blocks(self.nodes)
comments.body: You can use `self.sync_all()` here to avoid the additional import.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -18,8 +21,7 @@ def set_test_params(self):
     def run_test(self):
         # Generate block to get out of IBD
         self.nodes[0].generate(1)
-
-        self.log.info("listreceivedbyaddress Test")
comments.body: No need to remove this. It looks like this log indicates that this part of the test is for `listreceivedbyaddress` compared with the next parts of the test for `getreceivedbyaddress` and `listreceivedbylabel`/`getreceivedbylabel`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -18,8 +21,7 @@ def set_test_params(self):
     def run_test(self):
         # Generate block to get out of IBD
         self.nodes[0].generate(1)
-
-        self.log.info("listreceivedbyaddress Test")
comments.body: Thanks. Removing the log statement was incorrect. Fixed up...
